;
;;罗伯特·梅嫩德斯
;

;包括他自己的州州长在内的几位民主党人正在呼吁他们的党员罗伯特在联邦当局;指控新泽西州美国参议员及其妻子收受贿赂;。

;

;当局周五披露了指控，指控罗伯特和纳丁·梅南德斯非法收受金条、现金、一辆豪华梅赛德斯-奔驰汽车和其他礼物，以换取惠及三名商人的好处以及影响埃及政府。

;
;

;;相关：;;美国参议员罗伯特·梅南德斯及其妻子被控贿赂罪;

;
;

;对此，明尼苏达州民主党众议员迪恩·菲利普斯;告诉 CNN< /a>; 他对梅南德斯深感失望，这位参议员需要辞职。菲利普斯表示，这就是他的立场，尽管他相信每个人在被证明有罪之前都被假定无罪。

;

;“是的，我是民主党人，梅南德斯参议员也是，但根据我所看到的情况，我感到失望，并且是的，我认为他应该辞职，”菲利普斯说。

;

;他继续说道：“我感到震惊。任何关注的人 – 我不关心你的政治观点，无论是民主党还是共和党，你都应该感到震惊。

;

;“一位看似违法的国会议员是我应该相信的人应该辞职。”

;

;菲利普斯接着引用了共和党国会议员乔治·桑托斯的例子，他有;对 13 项欺诈、洗钱和盗窃公共资金罪名不认罪。

;

;“我认为乔治·桑托斯应该已经辞职了，“ 他说。 “可悲的是，我们众议院的道德程序，我也认为参议院，并不像它需要的那样熟练，所以我们必须依赖司法系统，但我真的很失望。”

;

;在回答国会民主党领导人是否应该迫使梅南德斯辞职并将其赶下台的问题时，菲利普斯回答道：“看，我正在努力恢复对政府的信心。

;

;“这是我的一个想法任务。这是我同事的很多任务，有时我们必须言出必行，即使这会让人感到不舒服。我认为，这一次，是的，答案是绝对的。”

;

;新泽西州民主党众议员安迪·金 (Andy Kim) 也呼吁梅南德斯辞职。 《新泽西环球报》;引用;金正恩的话说：“这些指控是严重且令人震惊的。无论你的职位是什么或你的政治观点是什么——在美国没有人可以凌驾于法律之上。

;

;“新泽西州人民绝对需要知道所发生事件的真相，我希望司法系统彻底而迅速地工作，使这一事实真相大白。”

;

;他补充道：“与此同时，我不相信参议员有能力正确关注我们的州及其人民同时解决如此重大的法律问题。他应该下台。”

;

;毫不奇怪，新泽西州的;共和党州委员会;加入了菲利普斯和金呼吁梅南德斯下台。声明称，梅南德斯的“法律困境是一种令人尴尬的干扰”。

;

;“为了这个州人民的利益，他们应该得到充分和忠诚的代表，我们呼吁……罗伯特·梅南德斯辞职。”声明补充道。

;

;在新泽西州，如果美国参议院有空缺，该席位就会;填补< /a>; 在举行特别选举之前由州长任命来替换被任命者。如果梅南德斯卸任，他的空缺将由该州的民主党州长菲尔·墨菲填补，这一现实也许会让菲利普斯和金坚持要求他们的党员辞职而感到不那么不舒服。

;

;墨菲本人也是如此在周五发布的;一份声明;中呼吁梅嫩德斯辞职。

;

;“起诉书中的指控……令人深感不安，”声明称。 “这些都是严重的指控，涉及国家安全和我们刑事司法系统的完整性。”近几个月来，民主党人不仅呼吁将桑托斯从国会中除名，还要求唐纳德·特朗普由于他正在应对四项独立起诉书中的 90 多项刑事指控，因此他不会竞选连任总统。

;

;众议院民主党人于 5 月提出了一项决议，将被起诉的桑托斯逐出国会，但共和党人成功 ;回避;这一举动。

; <与此同时，弗吉尼亚州民主党美国参议员蒂姆·凯恩本月早些时候表示，他;相信;有“强有力的论据”表明，根据宪法第 14 条修正案，特朗普可能会被取消参加 2024 年总统选举的资格。该修正案禁止任何宣誓支持宪法并“参与叛乱”反对美国的人，未经众议院和参议院三分之二的批准，不得担任任何民事、军事或民选职位。

; < p>;特朗普的指控包括与他的支持者在 2021 年 1 月 6 日总统选举中输给乔·拜登后对国会发起的攻击有关的指控。

;

;全国其他自由派人士以及著名法律学者回应了这一论点。

; Sat, 23 Sep 2023 06:22:01 +0800 Chinese dissident who held Tiananmen Square vigils flees to Taiwanhttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/sep/22/chinese-dissident-tiananmen-square-vigils-flees-taiwan-chen-siming
;;2023-09-22T17:57:14Z;
;
;;陈思明坐在桌子旁
;

;以;定期纪念; 1989 年在北京天安门广场镇压的民主抗议者已逃往台湾，他在那里请求帮助在美国或加拿大寻求庇护。

;

;在周五发布的一段视频中，陈思明表示，他正在寻求庇护。为逃避中国政治迫害，在桃园国际机场转机区。

;

;“中国警方针对我的维稳手段越来越残酷、疯狂，”他在帖子中说道。 “他们没有按照法律程序就随意拘留我，拿走我的手机，甚至对我进行精神评估。我无法再继续接受对我个人尊严的蹂躏、对我荣誉的践踏以及对我身体的威胁。”

;

;目前尚不清楚陈如何能够前往台湾，但他告诉美联社据媒体报道，他于7月22日离开中国。台湾是一个自治岛屿，中国声称拥有主权。

;

;陈说，自 2017 年以来，警方每年都会拘留他，主要是为了他一年一度的天安门广场纪念活动。他说，最短的拘留持续了一周，最长的为15天。

;

;在中国，纪念在镇压中丧生的抗议者的公共纪念碑很可能会引起警方的注意、拘留或逮捕.

;

;5月，陈在社交媒体上发布纪念抗议活动后，中国南部湖南省当局拘留了他。他描述了多年来在周年纪念日前后的“敏感时期”受到国安警察的骚扰。

;

;中国人权捍卫者组织表示，据信他被关押在湖南株洲的一个看守所不久之后。

;

;该组织敦促台湾帮助陈寻求庇护。该组织的研究和宣传协调员威廉·尼(William Nee)表示：“如果陈思明被遣返回中国，他几乎肯定会面临被拘留、酷刑和其他虐待以及不公平审判的风险。”

;

;会发生什么对于陈来说，接下来的事情将会很复杂。台湾没有正式的难民政策，并且对中国带来的安全风险越来越警惕。由于北京对香港的控制日益加强，它拒绝了一些寻求离开香港的人的永久居留权。

;

;陈说，他意识到风险，但更喜欢台湾，而不是逃到泰国或老挝，因为其他地方中国持不同政见者经常逃离。

;

;“我非法进入台湾，但台湾是一个民主自由的社会、一个国家。即使我坐在这里，我也会感到安全。”陈说。

; Sat, 23 Sep 2023 05:52:01 +0800 Revelations of Clarence Thomas’s Koch links stoke supreme court reform callshttps://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2023/sep/22/clarence-thomas-koch-revelations-calls-supreme-court-reform
;;2023-09-22T20:00:08Z;
;
;;2016 年 6 月，克拉伦斯·托马斯在美国最高法院大楼的办公室里。
;

;A <一份 href="https://www.propublica.org/article/clarence-thomas-secretly-attending-koch-brothers-donor-events-scotus">;报告;，详细介绍了克拉伦斯·托马斯如何秘密参与举办的捐助活动极右翼科赫网络的言论引发了对保守派最高法院法官不断增多的道德丑闻的更激烈的抗议和愤怒。托马斯和其他法官;说;：“哦，天哪。”

;

;“更多未公开的私人飞机旅行，亿万富翁资助的法庭操纵者的更多指纹 ;Leonard Leo;”——一位与托马斯有广泛联系的右翼活动人士——“更多地与亿万富翁资助的组织进行接触，密谋影响法院。”

;

;来自纽约，;威彻斯特县民主党地方检察官米米·罗卡;;说;：“作为牺牲捐助资金的公务员（我不接受民选官员的捐款......或在我办公室处理案件的律师的捐款），因为我相信司法系统应该免受甚至是表面上的政治影响，这让我感到恶心。”;

;将托马斯与科赫捐赠者峰会联系起来的报道是在波希米亚格罗夫（加利福尼亚州的一个全男性度假村）;这只是 ProPublica 的最新重磅新闻;，该非营利新闻编辑室拥有 ;由于他未能在法庭上申报与经常与生意相关的富有的右翼捐赠者的联系和慷慨的礼物，而追捕;法官。

;

;媒体包括;纽约时报;和;政治; 还报道了托马斯与他的妻子 ;Loper Bright Enterprises 诉 Raimondo;，涉及联邦机构在劳工权利、环境和消费者保护等领域监管企业的权利.

;

;科赫发言人否认托马斯的旅行有不当行为，;说; ：“像所有法官一样，参加一些活动来宣传一本书或发表晚宴讲话，可能会在某种程度上产生不当影响，这种想法是站不住脚的。”

;

;托马斯没有发表评论。他表示，他没有申报捐赠者的礼物，因为他被告知不必这样做。随后的文件;披露了;更多此类链接.

;

;最高法院法官名义上与所有联邦法官一样遵守相同的道德规则。

;

;周五，前白宫道德律师理查德·佩因特 (Richard Painter) 现在成为一名法律;明尼苏达大学教授;，;说;新的ProPublica报告显示托马斯“违反了：1）财务披露法，2）禁止法官参与党派筹款的法律（科赫家族有一个超级政治行动委员会）以及3）法官回避法。 28 USC 455。他根本不理解或不关心法律”。

;

;然而，在实践中，法官是自我管理的。首席大法官约翰·罗伯茨 (John Roberts) 拒绝了在国会作证的要求，因为有报道称，右翼捐助者与另一位极右翼法官塞缪尔·阿利托 (Samuel Alito) 有联系。

;

;参议院民主党人推进了道德改革，但遭到共和党人的反对和反对。控制众议院，它几乎没有成功的机会。

;

;呼吁托马斯;辞职或被弹劾;来自像纽约进步派女议员亚历山大·奥卡西奥-科尔特斯这样有影响力的人物。

;

;但是这样的人呼吁也几乎没有产生结果的机会。只有一位最高法院法官被弹劾：塞缪尔·蔡斯 (Samuel Chase)，;弹劾失败;，于 1804 年-05。 1969 年，阿贝·福塔斯;辞职;，金融交易丑闻。

;

;托马斯 75 岁，但没有明显的理由辞职或退休。作为最高法院的资深保守派，他是右翼多数派中的关键一员，该多数派是由国会中的活动人士和共和党人多年打造的，以 6 比 3 的比例，做出了包括取消堕胎权在内的划时代决定。

;

;Accountable.us 的赫里格补充道：“随着托马斯和其他人违反道德规范的行为不断增多，首席大法官罗伯茨缺乏行动变得更加令人震惊。首席大法官必须要求托马斯法官回避即将审理的涉及科赫网络利益冲突的案件。我们现在需要问责和改革。”

;

;媒体观察家也对新的 ProPublica 报告做出了反应。

;

;《纽约客》的 Jane Mayer，;《奇怪的正义》;，这是一本关于 1991 年托马斯备受争议的确认的开创性书籍，;询问< /a>;：“科赫的正义会更好吗？”

;

;Dahlia Lithwick，为 Slate 杂志报道最高法院并主持 ;Amicus; 播客，;简单地写道;：“付款。到。玩。”

;

;大卫·罗斯科普夫 (David Rothkopf)，专栏作家，著作包括《叛徒：从本尼迪克特·阿诺德到唐纳德·特朗普的美国背叛史》，;问;：“克拉伦斯·托马斯是我们历史上最腐败的最高法院法官吗？我们历史上最腐败的高级官员之一？

;

;“毫无疑问。”

; Sat, 23 Sep 2023 04:22:01 +0800 Zelenskiy urges Canada to stay with Ukraine as he speaks to parliamenthttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/sep/22/zelenskiy-trudeau-canada-parliament-ukraine-war-russia
;;2023-09-22T19:03:59Z;
;
;;Vlodymyr Zelenskiy 和贾斯汀·特鲁多于 9 月 22 日在加拿大安大略省渥太华国会山。
;

;弗拉基米尔·泽连斯基 (Volodymyr Zelenskiy) 在前往加拿大议会寻求加强西方盟友对;乌克兰;对抗俄罗斯入侵的战争。

;

;“莫斯科必须一劳永逸地失败。它将会失败，”泽伦斯基周五在议会讲话时说道。

;
;

;;相关：;;即使共和党支持减弱，泽连斯基仍获得 3.25 亿美元的美国新援助;

;
;

;泽伦斯基表示;加拿大;一直处于“历史光明的一面” ”在过去的战争中，并表示通过援助在这场战争中拯救了数千人的生命。

;

;他还感谢加拿大人提供的财政支持，并使逃离战争的乌克兰人在加拿大有宾至如归的感觉。

;

; >;

;泽连斯基多次向加拿大表示感谢，并获得了多位政要和议员起立鼓掌。

;

;泽连斯基此前在贾斯汀·特鲁多的办公室表示：“乌克兰向你们表达了很多热情的话语和感谢。”他的讲话。 “你们在战场上为我们提供了经济和人道主义援助……与我们一起走向胜利。”

;

;加拿大总理称这次访问是向泽连斯基展示“我们有多么坚定和明确”的机会。与乌克兰站在一起”，并宣布三年内追加投资 6.5 亿加元（4.82 亿美元），用于在加拿大生产 50 辆装甲车。

;

;这是自俄罗斯去年入侵乌克兰以来，泽连斯基首次访问加拿大。 2022 年 2 月。战争开始后，他几乎在加拿大议会发表了讲话。

;

;“我已经明确表示，我们的政府将与你们站在一起，只要需要，”特鲁多在讲话中说道。< /p>;

;特鲁多表示，自战争开始以来，加拿大已向乌克兰提供了近90亿加元的军事、财政和人道主义支持。

;

;泽连斯基和特鲁多还计划前往多伦多会见乌克兰政府官员。乌克兰当地社区。加拿大居住着;大约 140 万乌克兰裔< /a>;，接近人口的 4%。

;

;自战争爆发以来，已有超过 175,000 名乌克兰人来到加拿大，另有 700,000 人已获得批准，作为支持临时搬迁计划的一部分。那些逃离战争的人。该倡议允许获得三年期开放工作许可证，并有机会获得永久居留权和公民身份。

;

;泽伦斯基在华盛顿面临着有关美元流动的问题，19 个月来，美元一直帮助他的部队继续战斗对抗俄罗斯军队。以拜登在 2024 年白宫竞选中的主要竞争对手唐纳德·特朗普为首的共和党极右翼越来越反对向海外派遣更多资金。

;

;他还面临着欧洲和欧洲的挑战。乌克兰背后基本上团结的西方联盟出现裂痕。周三晚间，波兰总理表示，波兰不再向乌克兰提供武器，这一言论似乎旨在向基辅施压，并随着邻国之间的贸易争端升级，使波兰作为军事装备主要来源国的地位受到质疑。;

;泽伦斯基于 2019 年首次对加拿大进行正式访问。

;

;泽伦斯基首次对加拿大进行正式访问。 p>;

;“考虑到美国国会中许多共和党人不愿进一步支持乌克兰，以及乌克兰与其一些主要盟友（如波兰）之间的紧张关系，加拿大被视为乌克兰的可靠支持者，因此泽连斯基在蒙特利尔麦吉尔大学政治学教授 Daniel Béland 表示：“这里需要牢记的一个关键事实是，4% 的加拿大人有乌克兰血统，其中包括副总理克里斯蒂亚·弗里兰部长。”

; Sat, 23 Sep 2023 03:22:01 +0800 White House planning for government shutdown after chaos on Capitol Hillhttps://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2023/sep/22/us-government-shutdown-kevin-mccarthy-spending-bill

;;凯文·麦卡锡被媒体包围

;共和党领导的美国众议院几乎消失了在周四突然结束工作后的长周末，陷入困境的演讲者凯文·麦卡锡;未能推进权宜之计的政府支出法案;，因为成员们继续在距离避免联邦关闭仅剩几天的时间发生冲突。

;
;

;;相关：;;美国关门迫在眉睫，麦卡锡的众议院议长职位岌岌可危;

; Sat, 23 Sep 2023 02:22:01 +0800 The vast majority of NFTs are now worthless, new report showshttps://www.theguardian.com/technology/2023/sep/22/nfts-worthless-price
;;2023-09-22T17:39:33Z;
;
;;woman looks at an NFT of lots of numbers
;

;Tens of thousands of NFTs that were once deemed the newest rage in tech and dragged in celebrities, artists and even Melania Trump have now been declared virtually worthless.

;

;According to a new ;report; by dappGambl that reviewed data from NFT Scan and CoinMarketCap, 69,795 out of 73,257 NFT collections have a market cap of 0 Ether, leaving 95% of those holding NFT collections – or 23 million people – with worthless investments.

;
;

;;Related: ;;Jury rules artist's NFTs of 'MetaBirkins' violate Hermès' trademark rights;

;
;

;NFTs, or non-fungible tokens, are a form of crypto asset that is used to certify ownership and authenticity of a digital file including an image, video or text.

;

;The report comes nearly two years after the craze for NFTs swept up celebrities and artists alike, with many rushing to ;purchase; NFT collections of the Bored Ape Yacht Club and Matrix avatars.

;

;In March 2021, the crypto entrepreneur Sina Estavi made headlines when he ;paid; $2.9m for an NFT of the first tweet from the former Twitter boss Jack Dorsey. Meanwhile, in December 2021, the former first lady ;launched; an NFT collection named Melania's Vision which included a limited edition digital artwork of her eyes.

; ;

;The drastic downward market shift surrounding such crypto assets “underscores the need for careful due diligence before making any purchases, especially one of high value”, the report said.

;

;“This daunting reality should serve as a sobering check on the euphoria that has often surrounded the NFT space. Amid stories of digital art pieces selling for millions and overnight success stories, it is easy to overlook the fact that the market is fraught with pitfalls and potential losses,” it added.

;

;The report revealed that 79% of all NFT collections have remained unsold, as there is not enough demand to keep up with the supply in what researchers have described as a “highly speculative and volatile market”.

;

;To analyze the current state of top NFT assets, dappGambl researchers looked at the top 8,850 NFT collections according to CoinMarketCap.

;

;They found that 18% of these top collections have a floor price of zero, essentially being worthless. Forty-one per cent of the top collections have been priced between $5 and $100, which may indicate a lack of perceived value attached to these assets, the report revealed. Moreover, less than 1% of the collections are worth more than $6,000, a stark shift from the ;million-dollar deals; that dominated a; $22bn market; in 2021.

;

;The study also analyzed the costly environmental impact surrounding the minting process of NFTs. Researchers identified 195,699 NFT collections with no apparent owners or market share and found that the energy required to mint the NFTs is comparable to 27,789,258 kWh, resulting in an emission of approximately 16,243 metric tons of CO2.

;

;To put the staggering number into context, the report revealed that 16,243 metric tons of CO2 is equivalent to the yearly emissions of 2,048 homes. It is also equivalent to the yearly emissions of 3,531 cars or the carbon footprint of 4,061 passengers flying from London to Wellington, New Zealand.

;

;In addition, the report revealed that the number of dead NFTs could even be higher.

;

;“MacContract on Ethereum has a floor price of $13,234,204.2, but its all-time sales is only $18,” the report said, adding: “This stark discrepancy between listed floor prices and actual sales data exposes a significant issue in the NFT market – inflated valuations that don't reflect genuine buyer interest or real-world transactions.

;

;“It becomes clear that a significant portion of the NFT market is characterized by speculative and hopeful pricing strategies that are far removed from the actual trading history of these assets,” it said.

;

;Despite the volatility of the NFT market, dappGambl researchers said that they believe NFTs still have a place in the future.

;

;In order to survive market downturns and have lasting value, NFTs need to be either historically relevant such as first-edition Pokémon cards, true art or provide genuine utility, they said in the report.

; Sat, 23 Sep 2023 01:52:01 +0800 Five siblings jailed for illegally extracting water feeding Spanish nature reservehttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/sep/22/five-siblings-jailed-for-illegally-extracting-water-feeding-spanish-nature-reserve

;

;Five siblings have been jailed for more than three years for illegally extracting water from an aqueduct feeding a Unesco-listed Spanish nature reserve ;that is threatened by desertification;, a court ruling showed.

;

;The farmers – four men and a woman – were found guilty of crimes against the environment and causing damage through the “systematic and extensive extraction” of water supplying Donana national park, according to the ruling dated 18 September that was seen by Agence France-Presse on Friday.

;

;One of Europe's largest fauna-rich wetlands, Donana is located in the southern Andalusia region.

;

;If confirmed by a higher court, it would be the first ruling to involve a jail sentence for illegally tapping water from Donana, a site that has become a symbol of the growing scarcity of water in Spain which is causing fierce political debate, El Pais newspaper said.

;

;The siblings were found guilty of extracting 19m cubic litres of water for their Hato Blanco Viejo ranch between 2008 and 2013, leaving the groundwater reserves in “poor condition” and causing permanent lagoons to become seasonal due to the lower water levels, it said.

;
;

;;Related: ;;Water wars: meet the guardians of one of Europe's most vital wetlands;

;
;

;The defendants, who have been given more than a dozen fines for water-related issues since the last 1990s, must also pay €2m (£1.74m) in compensation to the Guadalquivir Water Authority, the public body responsible for local water management. They have been banned from cultivating crops for two years.

;

;Donana, a diverse ecosystem of lagoons, marshes, forests and dunes that stretches across 100,000 hectares, is on the annual migratory route of millions of birds and is home to many rare species, such as the Iberian lynx.

;

;The park has been struggling due to an ongoing drought and is threatened by intensive agriculture in the area.

;

;Despite warnings from Unesco and the European Commission, Andalusia's right-wing regional government ;is pushing to extend irrigation rights near the park;, with a draft law seeking to regularise berry farms that are irrigated by illegal wells.

;

;The bill will be put to a vote in the coming weeks and if it passes, environmental groups say it could legitimise 1,500ha (3,700 acres) of crops and jeopardise the future of the reserve.

;

;In that instance, Spain's left-wing government has pledged to appeal while Unesco has said the park could lose its status as a protected world heritage site.

;

;The draft bill played a key role in political campaigning ahead of local polls in May and a general election in July in a country where 80% of water resources are used in agriculture.

;

;Spain is the world's biggest exporter of olive oil and the European Union's biggest producer of fruit and vegetables.

;Rishi Sunak is considering introducing some of the world's toughest anti-smoking measures that would in effect ban the next generation from ever being able to buy cigarettes, the Guardian has learned.

;

;Whitehall sources said the prime minister was looking at measures similar to those brought in by ;New Zealand last December;. They involved steadily increasing the legal smoking age so tobacco would end up never being sold to anyone born on or after 1 January 2009.

;

;A New Zealand-style anti-smoking policy would mean cigarettes were phased out completely for the next generation. ;

;Labour has previously said it was consulting on phasing out cigarette sales over time for younger people in a similar way to New Zealand, with the shadow health secretary, Wes Streeting, saying in January he wanted to find out whether there was an “appetite for change” in the country.

;

;The policies under consideration are part of a new consumer-focused drive from Sunak's team before next year's election. This week the prime minister was widely criticised by business, centrist Tories and environmental groups for ;rowing back on his own party's net zero targets;.

;

;He was also ;accused of sowing uncertainty in education; after it emerged he was considering an overhaul of A-levels to move to a system more similar to the international baccalaureate, which allows students to study more subjects.

;

;In relation to Sunak's net zero rowback and confusion over his education policies, Keir Starmer, the Labour leader, said the government was creating instability in the country that was exacerbating an “economic bin-fire” under the Tories.

;

;“At a time when people and businesses are crying out for stability, Rishi Sunak has poured fuel on the Tories' economic bin-fire in a desperate bid to keep Liz Truss and her fellow arsonists happy,” he told the Guardian.

;

;“Britain has a once in a generation chance to reverse 13 years of decline and get ahead – to bring down people's bills, create quality jobs and free us from the grip of Putin and over-reliance on China. Rishi Sunak's weakness now stands between the country and proper national renewal.”

;

;Sunak is also under pressure over the HS2 high-speed rail line, with talks being held over whether to cut the Birmingham to Manchester arm of the project in a move that would infuriate northern Tories and further risk seats won under Boris Johnson in 2019.

;

;The prime minister is understood to be considering whether some infrastructure spending needs to be “reprioritised”, and cancelling the northern leg would potentially free up billions for the chancellor to use for pre-election tax cuts. The chancellor, Jeremy Hunt, said this week that the costs of HS2 were “totally out of control”.

;

;No 10 and the Treasury are also considering policies on law and order, and the possibility of holding down further benefit rises – both of which they hope Labour might oppose in order to have clearer dividing lines at the election.

;

;Downing Street insiders suggest Sunak has decided to pursue the policies that most matter to him under a ;“let Rishi be Rishi” approach;. However, the shift in the net zero agenda, drawn up under the guidance of the electoral strategist Isaac Levido, as well as the search for dividing lines in the areas of welfare and crime, suggest the policy changes are also ;highly political;.

;

;Sunak's autumn reset is likely to continue during conference season and the king's speech in November, with the party casting round for policies that could reverse its weakness in the polls.

;

;A YouGov poll found on Friday that the prime minister's net favourability rating fell to -45, his lowest score to date, after the net zero changes were announced. It found 68% of Britons have an unfavourable view of the prime minister.

;

;Separately, polling from Ipsos found the public were split over Sunak's policy of a delay to net zero targets. It found that, of those who knew something about the policy, 47% felt the government was right, and 46% that it was wrong. About 71% of 2019 Conservative voters who were polled and aware of the announcement said it was the right decision, compared with 24% of 2019 Labour voters.

;

;Asked about the policy of a New Zealand style-smoking ban, a government spokesperson said: “Smoking is a deadly habit – it kills tens of thousands of people each year and places a huge burden on the NHS and the economy.

;

;“We want to encourage more people to quit and meet our ambition to be smoke-free by 2030, which is why we have already taken steps to reduce smoking rates. This includes providing 1 million smokers in England with free vape kits via our world-first 'swap to stop' scheme, launching a voucher scheme to incentivise pregnant women to quit, and consulting on mandatory cigarette pack inserts.”

;今年早些时候，CCR 和《卫报》透露，Adnoc 的几名工作人员;在峰会上扮演了重要角色;，包括作为气候谈判代表。有些人甚至是从该石油公司的现有职位中借调的。

;

;6 月，《卫报》报道称，Adnoc 和 Cop28 共享 IT 系统，并且 Adnoc 员工 ;能够阅读 Cop28 团队发送和接收的电子邮件; 。国家石油公司还就如何回应媒体有关此次峰会的询问进行了咨询。当时，Cop28 团队坚称这些电子邮件保存在“独立的、受防火墙保护的网络”上。

;

;泄露文件中点名的两名 Adnoc 通信高管——菲利普·罗宾逊 (Philip Robinson) 和帕洛玛·贝伦格尔 (Paloma Berenguer)——拥有根据他们的 LinkedIn 账户，他们在化石燃料行业拥有 28 年的经验。在加入阿布扎比国家石油公司之前，他们都曾在壳牌工作过。

;

;Cop28 发言人表示，这两位高管本周没有随团队前往纽约参加联合国大会，也没有参与通讯活动

;

;“COop28 团队定期收到与 Cop28 无关的询问，并将其转给适当的阿联酋实体来回答，”发言人继续说道。

;

;该文件列出了 Cop28 团队的职责为出席联合国大会的 Al Jaber 和高级团队成员制定公共关系策略和关键谈话要点。文件指出，联合国会议将“在第二十八届缔约方会议之前定下基调，为气候议程提供信息并塑造气候叙事”。

;

;阿尔贾比尔周三在联合国发表讲话时重申， “逐步减少”化石燃料是不可避免且必要的。但他没有呼吁完全逐步淘汰，联合国秘书长安东尼奥·古特雷斯表示，这是缓解全球变暖所必需的。

;

;“行动严重不足，”古特雷斯说。 “为了有机会限制全球气温上升，我们必须以公平和公正的方式逐步淘汰石油、煤炭和天然气。”

;

;泄露的通讯计划没有提及逐步减少或分阶段进行。 - 不再使用化石燃料。相反，它的重点是通过提高全球可再生能源产能、减少污染行业的排放以及为绿色投资提供融资来“快速推进能源转型”。作为 Adnoc 首席执行官，Al Jaber 负责监督该公司石油和天然气生产的重大扩张。

;

;“第 28 届缔约方会议主席一贯表示，逐步减少化石燃料是不可避免的，作为Cop28发言人表示：“公平有序的能源转型，必须与快速逐步推广零碳替代品齐头并进。” “这一立场在联合国得到了重申。”

;

;阿布扎比国家石油公司没有回应置评请求。

;

;萨比多表示：“化石燃料行业一直在不断地反复推动反对有管理地逐步淘汰所有化石燃料，因为这意味着他们核心业务的终结。”他呼吁采取措施保护联合国免受化石燃料工业和其他石油生产国“普遍”的影响。

;

;“Al Jaber 和 Adnoc 都是其中的一部分。但我们不要假装这只是 Al Jaber 一个人。”
